 Rector and Vice-Rectors 

 Among the many responsibilities of the position, the Rector: 

Has the immediate operational management and governance of the university

Supervises the preparation of the statute and possible changes thereto, as well as the university operation and development strategy

Reports on the execution of the development strategy

Performs activities related to labour law

Establishes, transforms, and closes doctoral schools, having taken the opinion of the Senate

Appoints and dismisses disciplinary spokespersons of staff, students, and doctoral students

Issues administrative decisions in matters indicated in the Act

Appoints persons to perform executive functions and dismisses them therefrom

Supervises the human resources policy of the university

Supervises the financial policy of the university

Provides leadership in maintaining academic standards, rules and regulations

Issues organisational regulations which determine the organisational structure of the university and the distribution of tasks within the structure, as well as the organisation and rules of operation of the university’s administrative bodies

Launches, transforms, and closes particular programmes and fields of study

Makes decisions related to admissions and the educational process in all forms in cases that fall outside the scope of the Senate

Makes decisions pertaining to students and doctoral students in cases that fall outside the scope of the Senate

 Rector's BIO 

Professor Jerzy Lis has been associated with the AGH University of Krakow since 1973 when he began his studies at the Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics, specialising in Materials Engineering. He received a doctoral degree in technical sciences in 1986 (in materials engineering), post-doctoral qualifications in 1995, and the title of Professor of Technical Sciences in 2000. He has been working at AGH University since 1978. For 10 years, he presided over the Department of Ceramics and Refractories at the aforementioned faculty. He has been elected vice-dean for four terms of office and subsequently served as dean of the Faculty of Materials Science and Ceramics. He served as Vice-Rector for Cooperation for three terms of office. He has been the Rector of the AGH University of Krakow since 2020.

In 1989, he travelled to the United States, where he worked as a visiting professor at the State University of New York at Buffalo. He also participated in short-term internships abroad and was invited to deliver series of lectures in: TU Bergakademie Freiberg (Germany), TU Clausthal (Germany), TU Münster (Germany), RWTH Aachen University (Germany), University of Limoges (France), Osaka University (Japan), Hokkaido University (Japan), Alfred University (USA), University of British Columbia (Canada), Universidad Panamericana (Mexico), Samara University (Russia), Institute of Structural Macrokinetics and Materials Science, Russian Academy of Sciences.

Professor Lis’ research specialises in materials engineering and chemical technology with an emphasis on the technology of obtaining advanced and traditional ceramic materials, special techniques of ceramic materials syntheses, examination of the properties of ceramics and composites, and their applications. He is an Ordinary Member of the Polish Academy of Sciences and a member of the Presidium of the Krakow Branch of the Polish Academy of Sciences. Professor Lis is also a member of the Polish Ceramic Society and the Polish Society of Electron Microscopy. For his activity in numerous foreign research societies, he has been awarded the title of 
Fellow of the European Ceramic Society 
and a prestigious 
Bridge Building Award
 given by the American Ceramic Society.

Professor Lis’ academic achievements encompass ca. 400 published papers, 6 books, 180 conference presentations (of which 125 international), and 18 patents. He supervised 13 successful doctoral dissertations and is currently supervising 4. He was also the supervisor of more than 100 master’s and bachelor’s theses. Professor Lis has been the head of 12 research projects carried out by the State Committee for Scientific Research and the Ministry of Education and Science (a supervisor of 5), the chief coordinator of 16 national and 3 international projects, the head of 5 research papers, which are part of the statutory activity of the AGH University, as well as numerous research projects commissioned by industry.

Professor Lis is a member of a number of foreign academic assemblies. In 2002, he was elected a member of the reputable World Academy of Ceramics. He is also a member of The American Ceramic Society, The International Society of SHS, and editorial boards of 
The International Journal of SHS
 and 
Ceramics International
. Moreover, for his academic achievements, he was a laureate of the following prestigious international awards: 
Fellow of the American Ceramic Society
, 
Fellow of the European Ceramic Society
, and 
The Bridge Award of the American Ceramic Society
. He has been distinguished with the title of Honorary Professor by the Shymkent University (Kazakhstan).

Professor Lis is also the president of the Supervisory Board of the Krakow Centre for Innovative Technology INNOAGH and the vice-president of the Kraków Technology Park.

At present, he is a member of the Polish Academy of Sciences Committee on Materials Sciences (vice-president for two terms of office), a member of the Committee on Civil Engineering of the Polish Academy of Sciences, a member of the Committee on Ceramics Sciences of the Krakow Branch of the Polish Academy of Sciences, and the vice-president of the Committee on Technical Sciences of the Polish Academy of Arts and Sciences. Professor Lis held the post of President of the Polish Materials Science Society for two terms of office. He was also a member of the Central Commission for Academic Degrees and Titles and the president of the Whiteware Ceramics Division of the Polish Ceramic Society. He is also a member of the editorial boards of the following Polish journals: 
Materials Science Poland
, 
Archiwum Nauki o Materiałach
, 
Inżynieria Materiałowa
, 
Materiały Ceramiczne
, and 
Ceramika 
– a newsletter of the Committee on Ceramics Sciences of the Polish Academy of Sciences. He is a member of the academic councils of the Institute of Metallurgy and Materials Science of the Polish Academy of Sciences, the Institute of Catalysis and Surface Chemistry of the Polish Academy of Sciences, and the president of the Scientific Council of the Łukasiewicz Research Network Institute of Ceramics and Building Materials. Additionally, for the 2020-2024 term of office, Professor Lis holds the position of the President of the International Affairs Committee of The Conference of Rectors of Academic Schools in Poland (CRASP) and is a member of the CRASP presidium. The AGH University Rector has been a vice-president of The Conference of Rectors of Polish Technical Universities (KRPUT) in the 2020-2024 term of office and a vice-president of the Council of Rectors of Higher Education Institutions of Kraków.

In 2019, the President of Poland awarded him the Knight’s Cross of the Order of Polonia Restituta. He was also awarded the Bronze Cross of Merit and a Medal of the Commission of National Education. He is a laureate of the Award of the Minister of National Education and the Award of the President of Division IV of the Polish Academy of Sciences. For his scientific and invention-oriented activity, he received the Tadeusz Sendzimir Medal, awarded by the Association of Polish Inventors and Rationalizers, as well as the title of ‘Złoty Inżynier’ 2016 [Golden Engineer] by the editors of 
Przegląd Techniczny
. He was awarded the 
Cracoviae Merenti 
distinction, the badge of 
Meritorious Service for Construction Engineering and Industry of Construction Materials
, as well as numerous awards for his activity in the interest of universities, industry, and associations.

Rector serves as the executive head of the university, plays a prominent representative role, and acts as the governing body over employees, students, and doctoral students.
